definition: to remain silent/to have nothing to say
to be left speechless/unable to respond
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words

sentences.english: They gazed in awe at their hero.
sentences.chinese: 那個孩子默默無言，以畏怯的目光凝視着他。

sentences.english: At the end of the son’s reply the father was speechless.
sentences.chinese: 聽完兒子的話，父親啞口無言。

sentences.english: We both looked with our mouths open for about five minutes before we said a word.
sentences.chinese: 我們張着嘴巴互相看着對方將近五分鐘，無言而語。

sentences.english: When moneys speaks the truth is silent.
sentences.chinese: 當金錢萬能時，真理無言。

sentences.english: Do not think that love into the depths is speechless.
sentences.chinese: 千萬不要認爲愛到深處是無言。

sentences.english: This simple question left Rei with nothing to say.
sentences.chinese: 這個簡單的問題讓麗無言以對。

sentences.english: Ghosts are hideously clamorous while God is silent.
sentences.chinese: 百鬼多猙獰，上帝總無言。

sentences.english: The blessing of the Lord is upon the head of the just: but iniquity covereth the mouth of the wicked.
sentences.chinese: 上主的祝福在義人頭上，災禍卻使惡人啞口無言。

sentences.english: Carreen liked him because of his placid and unembarrassed silences.
sentences.chinese: 卡琳喜歡他那種平靜而自在的默默無言的神態。

sentences.english: I couldn't understand why Mana Ina would not answer my parents when they asked her questions.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道爲什麼父母問曼娜艾娜問題時她卻啞口無言。

sentences.english: Any dumb cluck can remain in the darkness and die.
sentences.chinese: 任何無言的愚笨的人可以繼續再黑暗死亡中忍耐。

sentences.english: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，貧寒的人有指望，罪孽之輩必塞口無言。

sentences.english: She extinguished him with a single word.
sentences.chinese: 她一句話就說得他啞口無言。

sentences.english: A series of ironclad facts put him to silence.
sentences.chinese: 一系列鐵的事實駁得他啞口無言。

sentences.english: He was speechless when confronted with the elders' evidence and certificates.
sentences.chinese: 他在老人們出示的房產證面前無言以對。

definition: to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
